Executive:An Executive typically holds an entry to mid-level position within an organization          Responsibilities:          Task Execution: Executives are responsible for carrying out tasks and assignments assigned by their managers or supervisors      Support Roles: They may provide support to higher-level staff, assist in administrative duties, and help in the smooth functioning of daily operations      Project Coordination: Executives might assist in coordinating projects, ensuring tasks are completed on time, and contributing to project success      Data Handling: They could be involved in data entry, basic analysis, and generating reports based on the data collected      Senior Executive:A Senior Executive holds a higher level of responsibility compared to an Executive and typically has more experience or specialized skills      Their role might involve:Leadership: Senior Executives often take on more leadership responsibilities, providing guidance and support to junior staff      Project Management: They may be involved in overseeing larger projects, managing teams, and ensuring project objectives are met      Decision-Making: Senior Executives might have a more significant role in decision-making processes within their department or team      Strategy Development: They could contribute to the development of strategies and initiatives that align with the organization's goals          Qualifications and Attributes:          Executives and Senior Executives typically have a bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field, depending on the industry      Strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills are essential for both roles      Leadership skills and the ability to work effectively in a team are often more emphasized in the Senior Executive role

column2: Role & responsibilities   Position Title: MIS Executive - Manufacturing Company Location: Bangalore Job Description: As the MIS (Management Information Systems) Executive for manufacturing company in Bangalore, you will play a key role in managing and optimizing data systems and processes to support decision-making, performance monitoring, and operational efficiency. Your primary responsibility will be to develop, maintain, and analyze various reports and databases to provide actionable insights to management. Key responsibilities include: 1. Data Management: Collect, validate, and organize data from multiple sources, including production, sales, inventory, finance, and other departments. Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and integrity through regular audits and validation checks. 2. Report Generation: Develop and generate routine and ad-hoc reports, dashboards, and analytical insights to support management decision-making and strategic planning. Customize reports as per specific requirements and ensure timely delivery to stakeholders. 3. Database Maintenance: Maintain and update databases, spreadsheets, and other data repositories to ensure accessibility, usability, and security. Implement data governance policies and procedures to safeguard sensitive information and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements. 4. Data Analysis: Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities, risks, and areas for improvement. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to management for optimizing processes, reducing costs, and enhancing performance. 5. Process Optimization: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline data collection, reporting, and analysis processes. Identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and areas for automation to improve workflow efficiency and productivity. 6. Technology Utilization: Leverage MIS tools, software, and technologies to enhance data management capabilities and analytical capabilities. Stay abreast of emerging technologies and best practices in MIS to continuously improve systems and processes. 7. Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on MIS tools, systems, and processes to ensure effective utilization and adherence to standards. Address user queries, troubleshoot issues, and provide technical assistance as needed. 8. Quality Assurance: Conduct regular quality checks and audits to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with predefined standards and guidelines. Implement corrective actions and controls to address discrepancies and improve data quality. 9. Documentation and Reporting: Document procedures, workflows, and best practices related to MIS operations and data management. Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for management review and decision-making purposes. 10. Adherence to Policies: Ensure adherence to company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements related to data privacy, security, and confidentiality. Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and comply with data protection regulations. Qualifications: * Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field. * Minimum 5-7 years of experience in MIS, data analysis, or related roles, preferably in the manufacturing industry. * Proficiency in MIS tools and software, such as Microsoft Excel, Access, or Tableau etc. * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and generate actionable insights. * Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management abilities. * Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functional teams. * Familiarity with ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems and manufacturing processes is a plus. * Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
column11: MIS Operations, MS Access, VLOOKUP, Formulas, Advanced Excel, Excel Report Preparation

Qualifications:  - Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, Business, or a related field. - Proven experience in MIS or data management roles. - Proficiency in creating data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Microsoft Excel, SQL,  Looker Studio & App Script). - Excellent Knowledge of Advance Excel & Google Sheets - Should know, VLOOKUP, H-lookup, Pivot Tables &, if possible, Macros. - Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices. - Strong communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team. - Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. column2: Accounting Supervisor - Receivable        (      Job Number:          HOT0AKIA    )          Work Locations      :          DoubleTree by Hilton Agra            PlotH2,  B2        Taj Nagri Phase 2 Yojna            Agra        282001                    With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories,  Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight.  From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The core responsibilities of an Accounting Supervisor - Receivable are to keep a proper record of all amount due to the hotel from guests,  concessionaires,  tenants,  credit card companies,  online transaction and employees.  Although not responsible to the Credit,  it will be necessary for both to work closely together in following up on overdue accounts.            What will I be doing?       As the Accounting Supervisor - Receivable,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       Keep a proper and accurate record of all amounts due to the hotel.        Ensure that the accounts and statements are rendered on a timely basis.        Ensure the maintenance of accurate records of all monies due to the hotel from (but not limited to) guests,  groups,  crew,  banquets,  employees and credit card companies.        Ensure the accuracy of all charges made to the various accounts on a daily basis.        Check back up documentation against invoices to ensure the accuracy of all information prior to it been sent out.        Adjust daily credit card payments to PMS and POS machines to ensure WeChat,  Alipay and other transactions are correctly recorded.        Respond to queries from guests and creditors and follow up outstanding commission enquiries from travel agents.        Ensure that the necessary documentation is submitted with invoices to substantiate charges and to ensure payment is made on a timely basis.        Ensure that accounts,  statements and follow up letters are sent on a timely basis.        Ensure the necessary information in regard to overdue accounts is supplied to the proper persons for follow up (i. e.  Credit or DOF).        Balance all subsidiary accounts receivable ledgers to the appropriate control accounts monthly and prepare aged trial balances of all accounts  receivable ledgers (including employee s accounts receivable).        Prepare all necessary reports in regard to accounts receivable.  It should be noted that the Accounts Receivable Clerk is responsible only for the preparation of the accounts receivable report.  It is the responsibility of the Credit to make the written comments.        Attend monthly credit meetings.        Handle employee ledger which include steward sales,  payroll deduction and statement,  subsequently preparing allowance vouchers to cover discounts / adjustments.        Post AR payment into PMS system (include cheque,  credit card,  etc. ) promptly.        Maintain an adequate and up to date filing system.                        What are we looking for?       To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:       University degree and above,  majoring in Finance / Accounting.        4-6 years of relevant experience.         Attention to details and good interpersonal skills.        Good communication skills.        Flexible in relation to working hours,  especially at month end.        Proficient in English and Chinese to meet business needs.        Possess system skills in Check SCM,  SUN.        Proficient in Microsoft Windows,  Word,  Excel,  etc.            What will it be like to work for Hilton?       Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                     Job      :        Accounting          Schedule      :        Full-time

column2: One Point One Solutions is looking for Certified CA to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.      A Chartered Accountant (CA) is a professional accountant who has earned the Chartered Accountant designation through education, training, and experience          The role of a Chartered Accountant varies depending on the organization and the specific industry, but generally, their responsibilities include:          Financial Reporting:Prepare and analyze financial statements in accordance with relevant accounting standards and regulations      Ensure compliance with accounting principles and guidelines      Auditing:Conduct internal or external audits to ensure financial systems are accurate and comply with regulations      Provide independent assurance on the reliability of financial information      Taxation:Advise on tax planning and strategy      Prepare and file tax returns, ensuring compliance with tax laws      Budgeting and Forecasting:Assist in the development of budgets and financial forecasts      Monitor financial performance against budgets and provide variance analysis      Risk Management:Identify and assess financial risks and propose strategies for mitigating these risks      Implement internal controls to safeguard assets and ensure accurate financial reporting      Management Accounting:Provide management with financial information for decision-making      Conduct cost analysis to support strategic planning and operational decisions      Financial Management:Advise on financial strategies, such as mergers and acquisitions, capital structure, and financing options      Manage and optimize the organization's financial resources      Compliance and Regulation:Stay up-to-date with changes in financial regulations and ensure organizational compliance      Provide guidance on regulatory issues affecting financial operations      Client or Stakeholder Interaction:Communicate financial information to clients, stakeholders, and management      Collaborate with other departments to provide financial expertise and support      Ethical Practices:Adhere to a high standard of professional ethics and conduct      Maintain confidentiality of financial information      Continuing Professional Development:Stay informed about changes in accounting standards, tax laws, and industry best practices      Pursue ongoing professional development to enhance skills and knowledge

column2: \A Management Information Systems (MIS) Executive in a Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) context plays a crucial role in managing and utilizing information systems to support the operations and decision-making processes within the organization. Here's an overview of what the role typically involves: 1. **Data Management**: An MIS Executive is responsible for gathering, organizing, and managing large volumes of data generated from various BPO processes. This may include data related to customer interactions, service performance, employee productivity, etc. 2. **Reporting and Analysis**: They design and generate regular reports and analyses to provide insights into BPO operations. These reports help in monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs), identifying trends, and evaluating process efficiency. 3. **System Maintenance and Optimization**: MIS Executives ensure that the information systems used in the BPO function smoothly and efficiently. This involves troubleshooting technical issues, coordinating with IT teams for system upgrades, and implementing optimizations to enhance performance. 4. **Process Improvement**: By analyzing data and identifying areas for improvement, MIS Executives contribute to the optimization of BPO processes. They may suggest and implement changes to workflows, tools, or methodologies to increase efficiency and quality of service delivery. 5. **Client Communication**: In many cases, MIS Executives interact with clients to understand their reporting requirements, provide updates on performance metrics, and address any concerns or queries related to data management and analysis. 6. **Team Support**: They may also provide support and training to other team members on how to use information systems effectively and interpret data accurately. Overall, MIS Executives play a pivotal role in leveraging data and technology to drive operational excellence and deliver value to clients in the BPO industry.
column11: MIS Operations, VLOOKUP, Pivot, HLOOKUP, Advanced Excel, Excel Report Preparation

column2: Stewarding Executive        (      Job Number:          HOT0AHGK    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton Bangalore Embassy Manyata Business Park            Manyata Embassy Business Park,  Rachenahalli,  Nagawara,  Outer Ring Road,  Bangalore,  India                    Bangalore        560045                    With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories,  Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight.  From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          A Stewarding Supervisor under the general guidance of the Chief Steward or Assistant Chief Steward,  oversees and supervises all aspects of stewarding operation during a shift,  in adherence to Hilton policies and procedures.  This role ensures that the cleanliness,  hygiene and sanitation of all kitchen areas,  equipment and utensils are maintained in accordance to established quality standards.            What will I be doing?       As the Stewarding Supervisor,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       Maintain a high customer service focus with customers in mind.        Possess a positive attitude,  take responsibility and initiative to resolve issues and communicate clearly with customers and colleagues.        Responsible for guiding the stewards in their jobs.        Assist the Chief Steward to control and analyze on an on-going basis the cleanliness of kitchen areas,  banquet rooms (back of the house),  equipment and utensils,  operating and cleaning supplies,  as well as team members  payroll,  related costs,  breakage and loss.        Provide sufficient cleaning supplies and equipment which are in accordance with sanitation standards and in good condition to the outlets and kitchen sections,  for stewarding operation during a shift.        Responsible for the results in implementing the cleaning schedule.        Take daily inventory and make requisition of cleaning supplies.        Responsible for the proper handling and maintenance of all equipment in the kitchen,  storing and safekeeping all flatware,  glassware,  hollowware,  utensils and related equipment.        Maintain and update the steward operating manual,  chemical charts and cleaning charts for the team s reference.        Prepare and monitor the requisitions of all chemicals and equipment.        Conduct and prepare the monthly operating equipment inventory.        Report and monitor the breakage and loss report for operating equipment.        Keep the storeroom in order.        Maintain the polishing machine and the deoxidizing bath in perfect order.        Operate and maintain the automatic dish-washing machine and other cleaning equipment.        Provide the restaurants with sufficient dishes.        Clean the floor and the tiles in the kitchen,  corridors and stewarding areas.        Assist the Chief Steward to check that all areas of the kitchen,  canteen,  and storerooms are up to sanitation standards.        Complete the FSMS checklist in preparation for service.        Check reservations for the day,  ensure that the team is aware of busy areas in the operation.        Perform all duties and responsibilities safely for yourself and others in the workplace.        Assist Waiters,  Bar Attendants and Kitchen team members where required.        The Management reserves the right to make changes to this job description at its sole discretion and without advance notice.        Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned.                        What are we looking for?      A Stewarding Supervisor serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:       Middle School diploma equivalent or above.        At least 3 years working experience in a 5-star category hotel.        Minimum of 2 years as a Stewarding Team Leader in an international brand hotel.        Possess a valid health certificate.        Knowledgeable of opening hours for restaurants and hotel outlets.        Capable of training and motivating team members.        Able to set priorities to complete tasks in a timely manner.        Able to work in a moist,  hot and sometimes loud environment.        Knowledgeable in HACCP.            What will it be like to work for Hilton?       Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. Excellent computer skills with the ability to quickly learn new software applications. 6. High attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and management. 7. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written. 8. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as collaboratively in a team environment. Join Our Team: If you are a dedicated individual with a passion for data accuracy and efficiency, along with excellent computer skills and communication abilities, we encourage you to apply for the Data Entry Operator position at Ecure Healthcare Pvt. Ltd. Apply now and be a part of our dynamic team!

Chandigarh University is currently seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Student Care Executive to join our team.    Job Title: Student Care Executive    Location: Chandigarh, India    Job Type: Full-time    About Chandigarh University:  Chandigarh University is a leading institution of higher education that is committed to providing a nurturing and supportive environment for our students. We are dedicated to helping our students achieve their academic and personal goals, and we pride ourselves on offering a wide range of services and resources to support their success.    Job Description:  As a Student Care Executive, you will play a vital role in providing exceptional care and support to our students. You will be responsible for creating a positive and welcoming atmosphere for students, as well as for addressing their needs and concerns. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:    1. Providing excellent customer service to students and visitors  2. Assisting students with academic and personal issues  3. Bachelor?? degree in education, counseling, or related field  2. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  3. Strong organizational and time management abilities  4. Ability to work effectively in a team environment  5. Empathy, patience, and a genuine passion for helping others  6. Prior experience in student services or education is preferred  7. Advanced Excel knowledge is must.   Share your resume at 9875965908 OR palvi.hrd@cumail.in

column2: Position Title: MIS Executive - Manufacturing Company   Location: Bangalore  Job Description: As the MIS (Management Information Systems) Executive for manufacturing company in Bangalore,  you will play a key role in managing and optimizing data systems and processes to support decision-making, performance monitoring, and operational efficiency. Your primary responsibility will be to  develop, maintain, and analyze various reports and databases to provide actionable insights to  management.  Key responsibilities include:  1. Data Management: Collect, validate, and organize data from multiple sources, including production,  sales, inventory, finance, and other departments. Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and integrity  through regular audits and validation checks.  2. Report Generation: Develop and generate routine and ad-hoc reports, dashboards, and analytical  insights to support management decision-making and strategic planning. Customize reports as per  specific requirements and ensure timely delivery to stakeholders.  3. Database Maintenance: Maintain and update databases, spreadsheets, and other data repositories  to ensure accessibility, usability, and security. Implement data governance policies and procedures to  safeguard sensitive information and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements.  4. Data Analysis: Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities, risks, and  areas for improvement. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to management for  optimizing processes, reducing costs, and enhancing performance.  5. Process Optimization: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline data collection,  reporting, and analysis processes. Identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and areas for automation to  improve workflow efficiency and productivity.  6. Technology Utilization: Leverage MIS tools, software, and technologies to enhance data  management capabilities and analytical capabilities. Stay abreast of emerging technologies and best  practices in MIS to continuously improve systems and processes.  7. Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on MIS tools, systems, and  processes to ensure effective utilization and adherence to standards. Address user queries,  troubleshoot issues, and provide technical assistance as needed.  " 8. Quality Assurance: Conduct regular quality checks and audits to ensure data accuracy, consistency,  and compliance with predefined standards and guidelines. Implement corrective actions and controls to  address discrepancies and improve data quality.  9. Documentation and Reporting: Document procedures, workflows, and best practices related to MIS  operations and data management. Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for management  review and decision-making purposes.  10.Adherence to Policies: Ensure adherence to company policies, procedures, and regulatory  requirements related to data privacy, security, and confidentiality. Maintain confidentiality of sensitive  information and comply with data protection regulations.  Qualifications:  ??Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related  field.  ??Minimum 5-7 years of experience in MIS, data analysis, or related roles, preferably in the  manufacturing industry.  ??Proficiency in MIS tools and software, such as Microsoft Excel, Access, or Tableau etc.  ??Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and  generate actionable insights.  ??Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management abilities.  ??Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functional  teams.  ??Familiarity with ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems and manufacturing processes is a plus. ??bility to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
column11: MIS Generation, Database Maintenance, Pivot Table, SUMIF, Report Generation, Countif, MIS Operations, VLOOKUP, Data Management, MIS Reporting, HLOOKUP

column2: Job Description: MIS Executive Position Overview:  As an HR MIS (Management Information Systems) Executive, your role involves managing and analyzing HR-related data to support decision-making processes within the HR department and the organization as a whole. Here's how your proficiency in Advanced Excel and formulas would be applied in this context: Responsibilities: Organizing and managing HR data such as employee information, attendance records, payroll data, performance evaluations, and training records in Excel spreadsheets. Utilizing functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, and SUMIFS to retrieve and summarize HR data based on specific criteria. Analyzing turnover rates, employee demographics, and other key HR metrics using PivotTables and PivotCharts. Generating HR reports such as headcount reports, turnover analysis, recruitment metrics, and performance appraisal summaries. Creating dynamic dashboards to provide HR managers and stakeholders with real-time insights into key HR metrics and trends. Implementing formulas and conditional formatting to calculate and visualize performance ratings, performance scores, and competency levels. Tracking recruitment activities, such as job openings, applicants, interview schedules, and hiring statuses, using Excel spreadsheets. Building candidate pipelines and analyzing recruitment metrics such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and source effectiveness. Creating visually appealing and informative HR dashboards using Excel's charting capabilities and visualization tools. Incorporating interactive elements like slicers, timelines, and form controls to enhance user interactivity. In addition to Advanced Excel skills, proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) software and familiarity with HR analytics tools can further enhance your effectiveness as an HR MIS Executive. Keeping abreast of HR best practices, industry trends, and regulatory changes is also essential for success in this role.
column11: SUMIF, Countif, VLOOKUP, Pivot, Power Bi, Conditional Formatting, Advanced Excel

column2: Job Summary:  The MIS Sales Business Support Executive plays a crucial role in providing support to the sales team by ensuring accurate and timely reporting of sales data and performance metrics. This role involves collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to generate insightful reports that aid in decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate effectively with various stakeholders. Key Responsibilities: 1. Generate daily, weekly, and monthly reports on sales performance metrics such as sales volume, revenue, margins, and market trends. 2. Collect and compile data from multiple sources, including sales databases, CRM systems, and external market research reports. 3. Analyze sales data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. 4. Create ad hoc reports and analyses as requested by management or sales team members. 5. Develop and maintain automated reporting tools to streamline data collection and report generation processes. 6. Collaborate with sales managers and representatives to understand their reporting needs and provide customized solutions. 7. Monitor sales activities and performance against targets, highlighting areas of concern or potential areas for growth. 8. Assist in the preparation of sales forecasts and budget plans based on historical data and market trends. 9. Identify process inefficiencies and propose solutions to improve data accuracy, reporting efficiency, and overall sales productivity. 10. Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to provide valuable insights to the sales team. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Statistics, or a related field. 2. Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in a sales or business support function. 3. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as Microsoft Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). 4. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights. 5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. 6. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and data integrity. 7. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. 8. Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) is a plus. 9. Knowledge of sales processes and methodologies is advantageous.

column2: The Pricing Data Support Assistant will provide services to the pricing, contracts, account management, legal and finance teams to facilitate various analytical, administrative, and interactive aspects of the pricing department.      Prepares for review all customer facing documents associated with the offer and proposal process, especially for new product launches.      Validate pricing established for all customers of transition product. Assists with the NDC changes program, coordinating all aspects of inventory monitoring and customer notification.      Updates various department pricing files and databases, including Team Connect and creates reports as needed by management.      Assists with the temporarily unavailable products and sends out notifications as needed in accordance with customer contract terms and conditions.      Monitors the discontinued products schedule and sends out notifications as needed in accordance with customer contract terms and conditions.      Deliver excel driven analytical financial and forecast models to support expediting product assessments.      Assist new product pricing analyst with basic model set up and configuration.        Qualifications:        Bachelor s Degree or combination of relevant education and work experience.      2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry, pharmaceutical pricing or commercial operations (Preferred).      PC skills (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook)      Excellent oral and written communication skills.      Ability to solve problems independently and exercise good judgment.      Passion for exceptional service to internal and external customers and stakeholders.      Preparation of all journal entries relating to the areas entrusted.      Coordination of preparing / gathering supporting documentation for the journal entry and approval of the final balances.      Ownership of ensuring black line is properly updated monthly with the final entries and support for approval.      Identification of anomalies month-over-month for elevation prior to booking final balances.      Inter-company reconciliations of loan balances, including interest.      Payroll Accounting: ADP Payroll Accounting, Payroll accrual, Bonus accrual, Sales incentive accrual, Leave encashment accrual (PTO), Benefits accounting (IBNR/self-insurance), Non-qualified deferred compensation.      Prepaid Expense: Amortization of prepaid REMS, Amortization of GDUFA Fees, Insurance amortization, Prepaid royalty amortization (Kashiv), All other prepaid expense amortization.      Product Intangibles: Amortization of product intangibles.      Intercompany Loan: Accounting for I/C loan, Accounting for I/C interest on loan, Fx revaluation on Ireland and UK loans.      Accrued Interest: Interest on term loan and revolver, Interest on interest rate swap, Unutilized fees, LC fees etc.      Accrued expense: Accrued legal fee (SGA & IP legal), Accrued HR and IT spends.      The Rebate Analyst is responsible for the timely and accurate analysis and processing of all assigned rebate payments, including the reconciliation of discrepancies:      Calculate, validate and process all assigned Rebates, including GPO administrative fees, billbacks, flat rebates, wholesaler admin fees and shelf-stock adjustments.      Reconcile and resolve discrepancies and provide detailed support for collection of invalid disputes.      Identify root cause of issues with discrepancies and recommend corrective action to eliminate future occurrences and reduce outstanding rebate deduction balance.      Submit validated rebates for payment per department procedure.      Participate and/or contribute to special projects as needed.      Update Rebate Tracker for assigned rebates.      Perform ad hoc analysis as required.      Perform other duties as requested.            Skills:        This role requires the ability to manage data, excellent Excel skills, good analytical skills, and clear and decisive communication between Bridgewater and India team members.      Analyst must have Ability to work independently, and the ability to multi-task.      Analyst must be organized, detail oriented and able to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

The main job responsibility is to work on income tax including tax cost estimate, tax filing at the tax year end and resolve queries from travelers or project managers on day-to-day base, and thereby work with tax vendor. Key Responsibilities Understand global as well as local relocation & transfer policies & assist travelers in understanding the policies Accountable for ensuring the delivery of high-quality tax service, and meeting all deliverable requirements Hands on working on India Tax process and Internal Mobility tools to record pre-assignment to post assignment activities Prepare various documents for tax calculations, tax cost estimate etc. as required Assist travelers on social tax & personal income tax applicability in host country Analyze the tax implications and prepare tax cost estimate information Coordinate with tax consultants wherever required Prepare ad-hoc analysis and reports as requested Develop knowledge and understanding of performance metrics and strive to meet and exceed them Need based reporting/decision making Work with other functions / teams to resolve issues in a timely manner Report issues, projects, and processing status to team leads timely Work with India payroll teams to process PF contribution for Inbound assignees Manage India annual tax return activities along with our tax vendors Resolve assignees queries and concerns pertaining to assignment Tax and TEQ's Track and chase tax refund payments and receivables. Track and Chase Tax equalization settlements Qualification Key Relationships Interaction Mobility Market Units Service Teams Cross Boarder Finance team Tax Vendors Client Financial Service Team Employee Tax Team Qualifications and Experience Education University degree or equivalent higher education qualification Professional  Qualifications Major in Tax, Finance or Accounting, or having relevant working experience Customer service skills Good English proficiency, and accommodate to English working environment Self-starter, good analytical, and time management skills Good proficiency in Microsoft Office software (particularly Word / Excel / PPT) Work Experience 5 to 7 years relevant working experience desired The Big Four working experience preferred

column2: ||Godrej Agrovet Limited II Hyderabad II Crop Protection Business & Seeds|| Position Title: MIS Executive Location: Hyderabad Experience : Min 1 year Salary : Max 3.6 LPA Job Description: We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented MIS Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining various aspects of management information systems to support decision-making processes and optimize business operations.  Responsibilities: 1. Prepare daily sales reports to track and analyse sales performance on a daily basis. 2. Generate daily stock reports to monitor inventory levels and identify potential shortages or excesses. 3. Maintain employee budgets and actuals to ensure accurate financial tracking and forecasting. 4. Create PowerPoint presentations as per manager requirements, incorporating relevant data and insights. 5. Compile monthly sales reports to provide an overview of sales trends, performance, and achievements. 6. Develop sales and collection forecast formats to facilitate accurate forecasting and planning. 7. Implement sales employee performance trackers to evaluate individual and team performance metrics. 8. Generate daily collection reports to monitor and analyse cash flow and collection efficiency. 9. Maintain sales liquidation reports to track and reconcile sales transactions and settlements. 10. Prepare reports and analyses as per manager requirements, providing insights and recommendations. 11. Calculate sales employees' incentives based on predefined criteria and performance metrics. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in any field. - Proven experience in MIS, data analysis, or a related role. - Proficiency in MS Office (i.e., Excel, PowerPoint, Word and other relevant software applications). - Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and generate actionable insights. - Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. - Attention to detail and accuracy in data collection, analysis, and reporting. - Effective communication skills, with the ability to present findings and recommendations clearly and concisely. - Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. - Experience with database management and reporting tools is a plus.

column2: Gaurs Group is looking for Executive - MIS to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, compile, and analyze data from various sources to generate meaningful insights and reports      This may include financial data, sales data, operational data, or any other relevant data sets      Report Generation: Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and presentations to effectively communicate key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and analysis to management and stakeholders      Ensure accuracy, timeliness, and relevancy of the information presented      Data Management: Develop and maintain databases, data repositories, and systems to store, organize, and manage data efficiently      Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with data governance policies      Automation and Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to automate data collection, analysis, and reporting processes      Implement tools, software, or scripts to streamline data management tasks and enhance efficiency      Data Visualization: Visualize data using charts, graphs, and other visual representations to facilitate data interpretation and decision-making      Ensure the clarity and user-friendliness of data visualizations      Data Validation and Quality Control: Perform data validation checks, identify data discrepancies or errors, and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to rectify data issues      Implement quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and reliability      Ad hoc Analysis and Special Projects: Conduct ad hoc analysis and support special projects or initiatives as required      This may involve conducting research, performing data modeling, or providing insights to support strategic decision-making      Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as finance, operations, sales, and marketing, to gather data requirements, understand business needs, and provide relevant insights and reports      Act as a liaison between IT and business departments      Data Security and Compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations, company policies, and industry standards for data security, confidentiality, and access control      Training and Support: Provide training and support to users of the MIS system or reports to enhance data literacy and promote self-service access to information      Assist in troubleshooting data-related issues and provide guidance on data analysis techniques and tools

column2: Data Management:Collecting, organizing, and managing data from various sources within the organization, including databases, spreadsheets, and software applications.     Data Analysis:Analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can be used to make strategic business decisions.     Reporting:Creating reports and dashboards to present data and information in a format that is easy to understand for decision-makers.     Database Management:Maintaining and updating databases, ensuring data accuracy, and optimizing data storage and retrieval.     Software Proficiency:Proficiency in using software and tools for data analysis and reporting, such as Microsoft Excel, SQL databases, and business intelligence software.     Data Visualization:Using data visualization tools to create charts, graphs, and visual representations of data for better understanding and communication.     IT Support:Providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users when dealing with data-related issues.     Data Security:Ensuring the security and privacy of data by implementing and maintaining data protection measures and access controls.     System Integration:Integrating data from various systems and sources to create a unified view of the organization's data.     Custom Reporting:Designing and developing custom reports to meet the specific needs of different departments or teams within the organization.     Strategic Decision Support:Collaborating with management to provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.
column11: Advanced Excel, Mathematics, Managing Director, MIS Executive, Scripting

column2: A Stewarding Supervisor under the general guidance of the Chief Steward or Assistant Chief Steward, oversees and supervises all aspects of stewarding operation during a shift, in adherence to Hilton policies and procedures.          This role ensures that the cleanliness, hygiene and sanitation of all kitchen areas, equipment and utensils are maintained in accordance to established quality standards.          What will I be doing         As the Stewarding Supervisor, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:      Maintain a high customer service focus with customers in mind.      Possess a positive attitude, take responsibility and initiative to resolve issues and communicate clearly with customers and colleagues.      Responsible for guiding the stewards in their jobs.      Assist the Chief Steward to control and analyze on an on-going basis the cleanliness of kitchen areas, banquet rooms (back of the house), equipment and utensils, operating and cleaning supplies, as well as team members payroll, related costs, breakage and loss.      Provide sufficient cleaning supplies and equipment which are in accordance with sanitation standards and in good condition to the outlets and kitchen sections, for stewarding operation during a shift.      Responsible for the results in implementing the cleaning schedule.      Take daily inventory and make requisition of cleaning supplies.      Responsible for the proper handling and maintenance of all equipment in the kitchen, storing and safekeeping all flatware, glassware, hollowware, utensils and related equipment.      Maintain and update the steward operating manual, chemical charts and cleaning charts for the team s reference.      Prepare and monitor the requisitions of all chemicals and equipment.      Conduct and prepare the monthly operating equipment inventory.      Report and monitor the breakage and loss report for operating equipment.      Keep the storeroom in order.      Maintain the polishing machine and the deoxidizing bath in perfect order.      Operate and maintain the automatic dish-washing machine and other cleaning equipment.      Provide the restaurants with sufficient dishes.      Clean the floor and the tiles in the kitchen, corridors and stewarding areas.      Assist the Chief Steward to check that all areas of the kitchen, canteen, and storerooms are up to sanitation standards.      Complete the FSMS checklist in preparation for service.      Check reservations for the day, ensure that the team is aware of busy areas in the operation.      Perform all duties and responsibilities safely for yourself and others in the workplace.      Assist Waiters, Bar Attendants and Kitchen team members where required.      The Management reserves the right to make changes to this job description at its sole discretion and without advance notice.      Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned.            What are we looking for         Middle School diploma equivalent or above.      At least 3 years working experience in a 5-star category hotel.      Minimum of 2 years as a Stewarding Team Leader in an international brand hotel.      Possess a valid health certificate.      Knowledgeable of opening hours for restaurants and hotel outlets.      Capable of training and motivating team members.      Able to set priorities to complete tasks in a timely manner.      Able to work in a moist, hot and sometimes loud environment.      Knowledgeable in HACCP.

column2: Gaurs Group is looking for Executive / Sr . Executive to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Executive:An "Executive" is typically a mid-level position within an organization      Executives are responsible for specific tasks, projects, or functions within their department or area of expertise      They often report to higher-level managers or directors and may supervise more junior staff members      The role of an Executive can vary widely depending on the organization, and it may encompass areas such as finance, marketing, operations, or human resources, among others      Senior Executive:A "Senior Executive" holds a higher-level position within an organization compared to a standard Executive      Senior Executives typically have more experience, greater responsibility, and more significant decision-making authority      They may lead larger teams, manage more complex projects, and play a key role in shaping the strategies and policies of their department or division      Senior Executives often have a deeper understanding of their area of expertise and contribute to the development of the organization's goals and objectives

column2: The Technical Assistance Coordinators (TACs) will be engaged under Project ACCELERATE for undertaking the following tasks:                               1. Sensitize ARTC, ICTC and TI staff on index testing processes.                           2. Support in carrying out index testing by coordinating with existing ICTC, ARTCs so that all newly diagnosed HIV positive individuals, LFU re-initiated PLHIV individuals, VL unsuppressed PLHIV individuals are offered index testing.                           3. Implement index testing activities in coordination with nearby facilities within a radius of 25 kms but the staff will be located in the high load facility or as decided by the DAPCU/SACS.                           4. Coordination with local TI NGOs to ensure KPLHIV reporting at the ARTCs and ICTCs.                           5. Support the ARTCs in following-up of missed cases (MIS 1 and MIS2), making telephone calls to those missed cases and report back to the ARTC.                           6. Support the newly initiated ART patients for treatment adherence including SVA related activities as applicable.                           7. Support ARTC in LFU tracking if necessary in close coordination with Care and Support team in the district.                           8. Link clients to Sampoorna Suraksha Kendras, One-Stop Centers available in the district.                           9. Support ART availability at orphanages and care homes where children infected and affected with HIV.                           10.To coordinate other staff for linking interested clients to online platform Safe Zindagi for available services such as PrEP, Mental Health Counselling.                           11. Maintain records and registers including registers for index testing, follow up of missed PLHIV cases and LFU cases.                           12. Submit monthly report and other documents as necessary                           13. To ensure confidentiality of the data/documents/individuals in line with NACO protocols                           14. To coordinate with district officials including DAPCUs (wherever present) and attend important coordination committee meetings in the district.                             Minimum Qualifications:                                     MSW, Masters in Sociology or Psychology                           At least 3 years of experience of working with Targeted Interventions, Programs working High Risk Groups or People Living with HIV as Manager, Counsellor or M&E positions                           Computer skills (word, excel, PPT), test will be taken up during the selection process                               Basic data analysis and documentation skill                               Excellent understanding of local context (state and district)                               Experience in mentoring and capacity building                               Can read, write and speak local language fluently.
column11: Selection process, Counsellor, Basic, Data analysis, Sociology, MIS, Social service, District Coordinator, Counselling, Testing

column2: IIDE is a top digital education institute that helps students and professionals learn the latest digital marketing skills. We're looking for a talented MIS Executive (Finance) to join our finance team and play a key role in managing and improving our financial data systems. Role Overview:  As an MIS Executive (Finance) at IIDE, you will use technology and data analytics to provide important insights and support decision-making in our finance department. You will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our Management Information Systems (MIS) for financial reporting and analysis. Key Responsibilities: Develop and Maintain MIS: Create and keep up strong Management Information Systems (MIS) for financial data analysis and reporting. Design and produce customized reports to meet the specific needs of different stakeholders, including management and other departments. Analyze Financial Data: Examine financial data to find trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement. Provide actionable insights to support strategic decisions. Collaborate with Teams: Work with different teams to integrate financial data from various sources. Ensure data integrity and consistency across the MIS platform. Optimize Processes: Continuously review and improve existing MIS processes and tools. Enhance the efficiency, accuracy, and relevance of financial reporting and analysis. Train and Support Users: Offer training and support to users on how to access and use MIS tools and reports effectively. Stay Updated: Keep up with the latest trends and best practices in MIS, data analytics, and financial reporting technologies. Drive innovation and improvements in the finance function. Requirements: Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field. Experience: Proven experience in developing and maintaining MIS systems in a finance role. Strong analytical skills and experience in financial data analysis and reporting. Proficiency in using MIS tools and software. Skills: Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently and in a team. Up-to-date knowledge of emerging trends and technologies in MIS and financial reporting. What We Offer: Competitive salary and performance-based incentives. Opportunities for professional growth and development. A supportive and collaborative work environment. The chance to be part of a leading institution in digital education.

Assisting with the preparation of operating budgets, financial statements, and reports.     Processing requisition and other business forms, checking account balances, and approving purchases.     Advising other departments on best practices related to fiscal procedures.     Managing account records, issuing invoices, and handling payments.     Collaborating with internal departments to reconcile any accounting discrepancies.     Analyzing financial data and assisting with audits, reviews, and tax preparations.     Updating financial spreadsheets and reports with the latest available data.     Reviewing existing financial policies and procedures to ensure regulatory compliance.     Providing assistance with payroll administration.     Keeping records and documenting financial processes.
column11: record keeping, compliance, documentation, payroll, financial statements

column2: A NON GOVERNMENT ORGANISATION AT PURULIA DEALING BOTH CENTRAL & STATE GOVERNMENT PROJECT WANTS MIS EXECUTIVE . HAVE KNOWLEDGE IN WORK AT BACK OFFICE & ADMIN PROFILE. SALARY UPTO 15K/PM. INTERESTED CANDIDATE SEND HIS CV AT astha.hrd@gmail.com
column11: MIS Operations

column2: Varuna Integrated Logistics Pvt. Ltd is looking for Executive - Company Vehicle to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As an Executive responsible for Company Vehicles, you will oversee the management, maintenance, and efficient utilization of the organization's fleet      This role involves ensuring compliance with safety regulations, coordinating vehicle maintenance, and providing support to employees using company-provided vehicles        Responsibilities:        Fleet Management:Maintain an up-to-date inventory of company vehicles, including details on usage, maintenance, and registration      Coordinate the acquisition and disposal of company vehicles as needed      Vehicle Maintenance:Develop and implement a preventive maintenance schedule for all company vehicles      Coordinate regular servicing, inspections, and repairs with authorized service providers      Compliance:Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies related to vehicle operations      Maintain accurate records of vehicle registrations, insurance, and inspections      Driver Support:Provide support and guidance to employees who use company vehicles      Address inquiries, concerns, and issues related to vehicle use and maintenance      Fuel Management:Implement systems for monitoring and managing fuel consumption      Ensure proper documentation and controls for fuel expenses      Reporting:Prepare and analyze reports on vehicle usage, maintenance costs, and performance      Provide regular updates to management on the status of the company fleet      Emergency Response:Develop and implement emergency response protocols for accidents, breakdowns, and other incidents involving company vehicles      Coordinate with emergency services and insurance providers as needed      Cost Management:Work to optimize costs related to vehicle operations, maintenance, and repairs      Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising safety and quality
